commit_message:
#412 - Disallow adding already existing AccountancyEntries

Change ensures that an AccountancyEntry that is already in the repository can not be added again by checking if the id of the AccountancyEntry already exists. Also adds a test case which checks for an IllegalArgumentException in case the same entry is added

results.message: Adding the same AccountancyEntry more than once should result in IllegalArgumentException! ==> Expected java.lang.IllegalArgumentException to be thrown, but nothing was thrown.

issues.title: Make it clear how to persist updated `AccountancyEntry`s
issues.body: In `Accountancy`, the `add(…)` method currently has two purposes: 1) adding a new entry and 2) updating/saving an existing entry. However, the latter purpose isn't clear to Salespoint framework users, neither from the method name (i.e., something like `save(…)` would be better) nor from the javadoc. The `AccountancyEntryRepository`, which has a `save(…)` method, is package private.
comments:
`AccountancyEntry` instances are supposed to be immutable (as that's how bookkeeping works), so I guess we need to make sure we don't write any non-new entries.

- [x] Add check for `AccountancyEntry.isNew()` and reject parameter with an `IllegalArgumentException` (Spring's `Assert` class might be helpful here).
- [x] Add test case that tries to call `Accountancy.add(…)` with an already existing `AccountancyEntry` and verify it's rejected in `AccountancyTests`.

labels.name: meta: contribution welcome
labels.description: Issues ideal for people new to the project
